The financial markets in Asia are mixed after the international Monetary Fund downgraded it's economic outlook
It's blaming a variety of factors for lowering global expectations including trade tensions between the U.S and China amid the dispute China's central bank this week again lower the amount of cash reserves banks must hold in their dissent to boost spending as NPR's Rob Schmitz reports
This is the fourth time that people's bank of China has cut China's reserve requirements this year it comes after Beijing pledged to invest billions of dollars and infrastructure projects as China's economy shows signs of cooling with investment growth at a record low
The move announced on the last day of China's weeklong national day holiday will inject more than a hundred billion dollars into China's banking system
And all is said shows China's government is worried about the impact of external shocks to its markets switches last week speech by us vice president Mike Pence who accused China of trying to undermine President Trump ahead of next month's congressional elections
China's also preparing for tough days ahead after the U.S has imposed tariffs on hundreds of billions of dollars worth of Chinese products

After bruising confirmation fight the newest Supreme Court justice Brett Kavanaugh's offering words of reconciliation during a ceremonial swearing in at the White House Monday Night capital said he's taking a job with no bitterness and sought to reassure the public that he will be fair
